Key Match Events: The Rangers dominated the Astros in the final two games of the ALCS, including an 11-4 win in Game 7.
Jose Altuve hit a dramatic three-run homer in the ninth inning to win Game 5 of the ALCS.
Adolis García had four hits and five RBIs, including two home runs, and was named ALCS Most Valuable Player.
Corey Seager homered in the first inning of Game 7.
Nathaniel Lowe hit a homer in the sixth inning of Game 7.
Post-Match Reflections: Astros third baseman Alex Bregman expressed disappointment, acknowledging the Rangers' strong performance.
Astros manager Dusty Baker appreciated the team's effort and professionalism, hinting at his possible retirement.
Catcher Martín Maldonado reflected on the team's accomplishments despite injuries and expressed pride in their resilience.
Outfielder Chas McCormick noted the team's poor home performance as a key factor in their loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros lost 22 of their final 29 games at home, including the playoffs.
The Astros became the second team to lose four games at home in a playoff series, the first being the 2019 Astros in the World Series against Washington.
